metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17101 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in LibTIFF 4.0.9. There are two out-of-bounds writes in cpTags in tools/tiff2bw.c and tools/pal2rgb.c, which can cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted image file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1').
